page.title: 13Housing around Gt.Asby
page.content: Houses Houses in this area are usually built of stone with slate roofing.The stone used is usually limestone or sandstone,the latter usually in the eastern part.Slates,too,are of two types-the larger,bluer Welsh, and the smaller, green Westmorland slates.Windows tend to be small, and walls thick, to keep the heat in.Many windows have sandstone surrounds, and these are often painted. Gardens are small,especially farmhouse gardens, and traditional cottage flowers and vegetables are grown.There are a few modern bungalows, but planners dislike these nowadays in the village itself.
